plaintiff.name: Maria Rodriguez
plaintiff.address: 456 East 78th Street, Apt 4B, New York, NY 10075

defendant.name: James Thompson
violations: VTL 1111(d)(1) - Failure to obey traffic control device (red light)
VTL 1225-c - Use of mobile telephone while driving

accident.location: Broadway & W 42nd Street, Manhattan, New York
accident.description:
On the above date and time, the undersigned officer responded to a motor vehicle collision at the intersection of Broadway and West 42nd Street. Upon arrival, observed Vehicle 1 (2021 Honda Accord) with significant driver-side damage and Vehicle 2 (2019 Ford F-150) with front-end damage.

Investigation revealed that Vehicle 1 was traveling westbound on 42nd Street with a green light. Vehicle 2 was traveling northbound on Broadway. Witness statements and traffic camera footage confirm that Vehicle 2 proceeded through a red traffic signal, striking Vehicle 1 in the intersection. Driver of Vehicle 2 (Thompson) stated he 'thought the light was yellow' and 'didn't see the other car.' Driver appeared distracted and was observed holding a cell phone at the time of the collision.

treatment_plan: Follow up with orthopedics within 1 week
MRI cervical and lumbar spine recommended if symptoms persist
Patient advised no work X 2 weeks
injuries.work_restrictions: Patient advised no work X 2 weeks
injuries.prognosis: Patient is unable to perform usual daily activities due to pain and limited mobility. Prognosis for full recovery uncertain pending further evaluation.
imaging_findings: ctCervicalSpine: No acute fracture or dislocation. Mild degenerative changes at C5-C6.
ctLumbarSpine: No acute fracture. L4-L5 and L5-S1 disc bulging.
xrayLeftShoulder: No acute fracture. AC joint widening suggestive of Grade I separation.

liability_analysis.fault_determination: Based on witness statements, physical evidence, and traffic camera footage, Vehicle 2 driver (James Thompson) is determined to be AT FAULT for this collision due to failure to obey traffic signal and distracted driving.

threshold_categories: Significant limitation of use of body function/system
90/180 Day Rule - Substantial limitation of daily activities
supporting_evidence: Work restriction: Patient advised no work X 2 weeks
Disc pathology: ctLumbarSpine: No acute fracture. L4-L5 and L5-S1 disc bulging.
Prognosis: Patient is unable to perform usual daily activities due to pain and limited mobility. Prognosis for full recovery uncertain pending further evaluation.
ny_serious_injury_analysis.notes: Case likely meets NY serious injury threshold based on documented injuries and limitations.

lost_wages.notes: To be calculated based on employment records

recommended_actions: Schedule MRI as recommended in treatment plan
Obtain employment records for lost wage calculation
Request traffic camera footage via FOIL request
Send preservation letter to defendant's insurance carrier
Request certified copy of police report
Obtain complete medical records from all treating providers
Consider demand letter after maximum medical improvement
